text: I have a loop that is my biggest time suck for a particular function and I'd like to speed it up.
Current, this single loop takes up about 400ms, while the execution for the rest of the function takes about 610ms.

code:
for ctr in xrange(N):
    list1[ctr] = in1[ctr] - in1[0] - ctr * c1
    list2[ctr] = in2[ctr] - in2[0] - ctr * c2
    list3[ctr] = c3 - in1[ctr]
    list4[ctr] = c4 - in2[ctr]

text: N can be anywhere from around 40,000 to 120,000, and is the length of all lists (in1, in2, listN) shown.
Does anyone know some Python tricks to speed this up?
I already tried using map instead, as I know it tries to compile to more efficient code, but it was about 250ms slower.
